sentence.Network_en: Tabloid newspapers pander to the lowest common denominator.
sentence.Network_cn: 小报都竭力迎合大众口味。

sentence.Network_en: He was forced to pander to her every whim .
sentence.Network_cn: 她每次心血来潮他都不得不依随她。

GRE词汇精选（核心词汇） ... pandemonium 喧嚣，大混乱 pander 怂恿，迎合(不良欲望) panegyric 颂词，颂扬.

list.abs: His films never pandered to public taste ., 他的电影从不迎合公众的口味.
another example of the government pandering to big business ., 政府明益大商家的另一例子.

the weakness of electoral democracy is precisely that talk is cheap – politicians lie to their voters , newspapers pander to popular prejudices , public opinions are superficial .选举民主制的缺点正在于说大话很容易——政客欺骗选民，报纸迎合大众的偏见，公共舆论则缺乏深度。
E的中文翻译，E中文是什么意思 - n词酷在线词典 ... 俄 1. Russia 阿 pander to 鹅(鹅,鵞) goose.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a noun): from Pandare, the name of a character in Chaucer's Troilus and Criseyde (see Pandarus). The verb dates from the early 17th cent

entry.def: If you pander to someone or to their wishes, you do everything that they want, often to get some advantage for yourself.

example.ex: He has offended the party's traditional base by pandering to the rich and the middle classes.
example.tran: 他逢迎富人和中产阶级，得罪了该党的传统支持者。

example.ex: ...books which don't pander to popular taste.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who procures customers for whores (in England they call a pimp a ponce)
2. arrange for sexual partners for others

auth_sentence.content: Politicians tend to pander, especially during the primary season.
auth_sentence.res_content: Politicians tend to pander, especially during the primary season.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Politicians tend to pander, especially during the primary season.

auth_sentence.content: A young poet who did not seek to pander to fashion.
auth_sentence.res_content: A young poet who did not seek to pander to fashion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A young poet who did not seek to pander to fashion.

auth_sentence.content: Politicians both on the left and right pander to the camps on their respective side of the divide.
auth_sentence.res_content: Politicians both on the left and right pander to the camps on their respective side of the divide.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Politicians both on the left and right pander to the camps on their respective side of the divide.

sentences.en: He panders to her every whim.
sentences.cn: 他对她的性子百依百顺。

sentences.en: His films never pandered to public taste.
sentences.cn: 他的电影从不迎合公众的口味。

sentences.en: The newspaper here pandered to people’s interest in sex scandals.
sentences.cn: 这里的报纸迎合了人们对桃色新闻的兴趣。
